title: The Indian Portrait exhibition identity and book font
content:
Hey guys,

Would really appreciate it if somebody could help me identify this font.  
It was used as a headline font for a temporary exhibition at the National Portrait Gallery.  
I've tried What The Font and done my own searches but have had no luck.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161953im_/http:/typophile.com/files/national-portrait-gallery-the-indian-portrait-campaign-8-2507_5782.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161953im_/http:/typophile.com/files/national-portrait-gallery-the-indian-portrait-campaign-7-3811_3767.jpg)

More images:  
 [http://www.manss.com/en/Project/National-Portrait-Gallery-The-Indian-Por...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161953/http:/www.manss.com/en/Project/National-Portrait-Gallery-The-Indian-Portrait-Campaign "http://www.manss.com/en/Project/National-Portrait-Gallery-The-Indian-Portrait-Campaign")

Font: 

 Sansa 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161953/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")

author: LyamB

comments.content:
Sansa Black (The Indian Portrait) and Sansa Ultra Black (The Singh Twins) and Sansa Light (the rest):  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/family/sansa/All/All/Bestsellers/2](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161953/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/family/sansa/All/All/Bestsellers/2 "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/family/sansa/All/All/Bestsellers/2")
